de.ityx.mediatrix.api.client

Interface ICConnection


  • public interface ICConnection
    Center connection class between business objects on the client side and corresponding objects on the server side. All requests are sent through the class.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • sendServerEvent

        Object sendServerEvent(String command,
                     List parameters)
        Sends a Server event The list of parameters to send should always fit to format [action, projectid, param_1, ..., param_n]
        Parameters:
        command - command to send
        parameters - list of parameters to send
        Returns:
        Returns the server side generated Object

      • exchange

        Object exchange(String category,
              String command,
              int id,
              Object parameter,
              boolean headless)
        Establish the communication with the Application Server
        Parameters:
        category - category of command. not used currently
        command - command to send
        not - currently used
        parameter - object to send
        headless - true if "Session closed" can be shown when a exception is occurred
        Returns:
        Object

      • getClientResources

        Map<String,String> getClientResources()
        Returns the client resource (for example resource bundle and properties files) as Map.
        It is possible for the application to customize these properties
        Returns:
        Hashtable return properties from properties.txt (path can be set in mediatrix.properties with entry "propertypath={path of file}"

      • getCurrentOperatorShort

        OperatorShort getCurrentOperatorShort()
        Returns an excerpt of the information about the current user. The online-state of the current user is assumed to be true, but it is not validated against the server. Don't rely on this information! You should only use this object to compare it against other object of this type. In most cases the use of API.getClientAPI().getConnectionAPI().getCurrentUser() is recommended.
        Returns:
        OperatorShort or null if current operator is null.
